sen.j: 楠本 正隆（くすもと まさたか、天保9年3月20日_(旧暦)（1838年4月14日） - 明治35年（1902年）2月7日）は、肥前大村藩の武士、明治期の政治家。
sen.e: Masataka KUSUMOTO (April 14 1838-February 7 1902) was a samurai from the Omura Domain, Hizen Province, and a Meiji Period statesman.
Masataka KUSUMOTO (April 14 1838-February 7 1902) was a samurai from the Omura Domain, Hizen Province, and a Meiji Period statesman.
Masataka KUSUMOTO (April 14, 1838-February 7, 1902) was a samurai from the Omura Domain, Hizen Province, and a Meiji Period statesman.
sen.cmt: 日付の後ろに,を挿入しました。

sen.e: He also held the title of baron.
He also held the title of baron.
He also held the title of baron.

sen.j: 大久保利通の腹心として知られた。
sen.e: He was known as a trusted advisor of Toshimichi OKUBO.
He was known as a trusted advisor of Toshimichi OKUBO.
He was known as a trusted advisor of Toshimichi OKUBO.

sen.j: 肥前大村藩士・楠本直右衛門正式（60石）の長男として玖島城下の岩船に生まれる。
sen.e: Masataka KUSUMOTO was born in Iwafune near Kushima Castle, the eldest son of Naoemon Masanori KUSUMOTO (60 koku).
Masataka KUSUMOTO was born in Iwafune near Kushima Castle, the eldest son of Naoemon Masanori KUSUMOTO (60 koku).
Masataka KUSUMOTO was born in Iwafune near Kushima Castle, the eldest son of Naoemon Masanori KUSUMOTO (60 koku).

sen.j: 藩校・五教館の監察、頭取を務めた。
sen.e: He served as a supervisor and head of at Gokyokan, a domain school.
He served as a supervisor and head of at Gokyokan, a domain school.
He served as a supervisor and head of at Gokyokan, a domain school.

sen.j: 中老として尊攘倒幕運動で活躍し、渡辺昇ら「大村三七士」の一人として知られる。
sen.e: He was active in the "sonjo tobaku" (revere the emperor, overthrow the shogunate) movement, and was known as one of Nobori WATANABE's "37 Omura samurai".
He was active in the "sonjo tobaku" (revere the emperor, overthrow the shogunate) movement, and was known as one of Nobori WATANABE's "37 Omura samurai".
He was active in the "sonno tobaku" (revere the emperor, overthrow the shogunate) movement, and was known as one of Noboru WATANABE's '37 Omura samurai.'
sen.cmt: sonjoをsonnoに変更しました。NoboriをNoboruに変更しました。二番目の" "を' 'に変更し、ピリオドを中に入れました。

sen.j: 1868年、徴士として新政府に出仕。
sen.e: In 1868 he served as an official in the new government.
In 1868 he served as an official in the new government.
In 1868 he served as an official in the new government.

sen.j: 長崎県判事兼九州鎮撫使参謀助役をつとめ、1870年に外務省権大丞、1872年に外務大丞を経て、同年、新潟県令として就任する。
sen.e: He served in the Nagasaki prefectural judiciary and as an assistant in the Kyushu peace keeping office; and was a senior secretary in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1870 until 1872 when he became governor of Niigata Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Confirm 九州鎮撫使参謀助役 = assistant in the Kyushu peace keeping office
sen.e: He served in the Nagasaki prefectural judiciary and as an assistant in the Kyushu peace keeping office; and was a senior secretary in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1870 until 1872 when he became governor of Niigata Prefecture.

He served in the Nagasaki prefectural judiciary and as an assistant in the Kyushu peace keeping office; and was a senior secretary in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1870 until 1872 when he became governor of Niigata Prefecture.

sen.j: 1875年の離任までの間、第四銀行設立など県の近代化に尽力した。
sen.e: Until he left this post in 1875, he worked hard in modernizing the prefecture, setting up the Daishi Bank among other achievements.
Until he left this post in 1875, he worked hard in modernizing the prefecture, setting up the Daishi Bank among other achievements.
Until he left this post in 1875, he worked hard in modernizing the prefecture, setting up the Daishi Bank among other achievements.

sen.j: 本邦初の国立市民公園の白山公園を開設する。
sen.e: He set up Hakusan Park, Japan's first national public park.
He set up Hakusan Park, Japan's first national public park.
He set up Hakusan Park, Japan's first national public park.

sen.j: その他、県議会の開設や地租改正推進などに努め、大久保からは「天下随一の県令」と賞された。
sen.e: As well as this, he established the prefectural council and promoted land-tax reform, and was praised by OKUBO for administering the "best prefecture in the country".
As well as this, he established the prefectural council and promoted land-tax reform, and was praised by OKUBO for administering the "best prefecture in the country".
As well as this, he established the prefectural council and promoted land-tax reform, and was praised by OKUBO for administering the 'best prefecture in the country.'
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更し、ピリオドを中に入れました。

sen.j: その後、地方官会議幹事長や内務省大丞を経て、1877年に東京都知事。
sen.e: After serving as chief of the local administrative assemblies council and senior official in the Ministry of the Interior, he became governor of Tokyo.
After serving as chief of the local administrative assemblies council and senior official in the Ministry of the Interior, he became governor of Tokyo.
After serving as chief of the local administrative assemblies council and senior official in the Ministry of the Interior, he became governor of Tokyo in 1877.

sen.j: その後、東京市会議員、1879年には元老院議官、元老院 (日本)副議長。
sen.e: After this, he was a Tokyo City councillor, and in 1879 joined the Chamber of Elders, becoming its vice-chairman.
After this, he was a Tokyo City councillor, and in 1879 joined the Chamber of Elders, becoming its vice-chairman.
After this, he was a Tokyo City councillor, and in 1879 joined the Chamber of Elders, becoming its vice-chairman.

sen.j: 1890年に衆議院議員に当選し、1893年には衆議院議長に就任した。
sen.e: In 1890 he was elected a member of the House of Representatives, becoming its chairman in 1893.
In 1890 he was elected a member of the House of Representatives, becoming its chairman in 1893.
In 1890 he was elected a member of the House of Representatives, becoming its chairman in 1893.

sen.j: 政党活動を通じて立憲改進党などを組織し、都新聞社主や社長も務めるなど民権の伸張や政界刷新に努めた。
sen.e: Through his party activism he helped set up the Constitutional Reform Party, and later became owner and head of the Miyako Newspaper, working for civil rights and political reform.
Through his party activism he helped set up the Constitutional Reform Party, and later became owner and head of the Miyako Newspaper, working for civil rights and political reform.
Through his party activism he helped set up the Constitutional Reform Party, and later became owner and head of the Miyako Newspaper, working for civil rights and political reform.

sen.j: 1896年、維新の功により男爵を授けられた。
sen.e: In 1896 he received the title of danshaku (baron) for his achievements in the Restoration.
In 1896 he received the title of danshaku (baron) for his achievements in the Restoration.
In 1896 he received the title of danshaku (baron) for his achievements in the Restoration.

sen.j: その後、錦鶏間祗候を拝命。
sen.e: Following this he was awarded the Order of the Golden Pheasant.
Following this he was awarded the Order of the Golden Pheasant.
Following this he was awarded the Order of the Golden Pheasant.
He died in 1902.
He died in 1902.
He died in 1902.
He was 65 years old.
He was 65 years old.
Died at the age of 65.
